Nonpharmacologic treatment options include lifestyle modifications, such as smoking cessation, exercise, and weight optimization. First-line pharmacotherapy for erectile dysfunction is oral

inhibitors (sildenafil, vardenafil [on demand], or tadalafil [daily]). These drugs are contraindicated in men who receive nitrate therapy in any form and in men with a history of nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy. They should be used with caution in men taking α-blockers because of the risk of hypotension.
Intraurethral or intracavernous alprostadil is a second-line therapy for men who cannot take PDE-5 inhibitors.
Testosterone therapy is reserved for patients with confirmed hypogonadism.
